p: After TLC elution of the most active oils, two inhibition bands, at retention factors (R f’s) of 0.67 and 0.12, were observed in all samples ( Figure 3). After scraping the active bands, the GC-MS analysis indicated that curzerene ( Table 2, Figure 4) was the main compound for the R f 0.67 fractions, comprising 97% and 82% for both flower and leaf oils. The band at R f 0.12 was composed by a complex mixture, with predominance of α-terpineol, α-eudesmol, and ferula lactone I ( Figure 4) in different proportions, not allowing to point only one single active compound, as presented in Table 2.
